content: most knitters i know have a bounty of yarn scraps left over from completed projects or an abundance of minis from swaps and fellow yarnie friends what do you do with these scraps make a scrap blanket of course this project makes excellent use of **all** of the leftover yarn each new yarn is joined at the end of the one before it this pattern is fully customizable to your preferences you can make it big or small it s totally up to you it can be knit in whichever weight yarn you have the most of you can even change the type of increase it s knit in the round and there s no seaming or edges to pick up --- **sizing & finished measurements** any size this is completely up to you suggested sizes baby- 30x30in/76x76cm throw- 60x60in/152 5x152 5cm full- 80x80in/203x203cm queen- 90x90in/228 5x228 5cm **yarn** fingering weight scraps of any amount other yarn weights can easily be substituted **notions** 4 stitch markers tapestry needle for weaving in ends
